title: Defenses
context: §667-4 Defenses. The mortgagor, or any subsequent mortgagee, may defend the action for foreclosure, and may show any matter in legal or equitable avoidance of the mortgage. [CC 1859, §1234; RL 1925, §2890; RL 1935, §4723; RL 1945, §12423; RL 1955, §336-4; HRS §667-4; am L 1972, c 90, §9(d)] Rules of Court Pleading under the Hawaii Rules of Civil Procedure, see HRCP rules 7, 8, 10, 12. Affirmative defenses, see HRCP rule 8&copy;. Case Notes Acceleration provision in mortgage although not in note secured is enforceable by foreclosure. 32 H. 420 (1932).
